title: Find the rate of energy dissipated

content.question: Resistors <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> are connected in series to the same battery. The resistors are made of the same material, but resistor <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> has twice the length and half the diameter of resistor <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>. If the rate at which energy is dissipated in resistor <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> is <math alttext="P " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the rate at which energy is dissipated in resistor <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
